DataElement.preferredName: Current Therapeutic Procedure Biphosphonate Administered Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response regarding whether current biphosphonate therapy is being administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the current biphosphonate (a family of drugs used to treat osteoporosis and the bone pain caused by some types of cancer) therapy (an action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: A family of drugs used to treat osteoporosis and the bone pain caused by some types of cancer. Also called diphosphonates.:Given.

Concepts.definition: A drug or substance used to treat hypercalcemia (abnormally high blood calcium) and bone pain caused by some types of cancer. Forms of bisphosphonates are also used to treat osteoporosis and for bone imaging. Bisphosphonates inhibit a type of bone cell that breaks down bone.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is receiving concurrent bisphosphonate treatment, was it initiated after the first dose of study therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is receiving concurrent bisphosphonate treatment was it initiated prior to the first dose of study therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient taking bisphosphonate therapy for symptomatic hypercalcemia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient does not have osteoporosis, is patient receiving prophylactic treatment with bisphosphonates?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is receiving prophylactic bisphosphonate therapy, does patient have bone disease except for osteoporosis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient currently receiving bisphosphonate therapy, are they able to temporarily stop bisphosphonate therapy for the duration of the study pending assessment of the need for calcium supplementation?
